paper_abstract: We apply results on extracting randomness from independent sources to "extract" Kolmogorov complexity. For any alpha, epsilon > 0, given a string x with K(x) > alpha vertical bar x vertical bar, we show how to use a constant number of advice bits to efficiently compute another string y, vertical bar Y vertical bar = Omega(vertical bar x vertical bar). with K(y) > (1 - epsilon)vertical bar y vertical bar. This result holds for both unbounded and space-bounded Kolmogorov complexity. We use the extraction procedure for space-bounded complexity to establish zero-one laws for the strong dimensions of complexity classes within ESPACE. The unbounded extraction procedure yields a zero-one law for the constructive strong dimensions of Turing degrees. (C) 2010 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Extracting Kolmogorov complexity with applications to dimension zero-one laws
